org.streaminer.stream.classifier.tree

Class HoeffdingTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.streaminer.stream.classifier.tree.HoeffdingTree
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Learner<Data,HoeffdingTreeModel>

    public class HoeffdingTree
extends Object
implements Learner<Data,HoeffdingTreeModel>
    Learns a HoeffdingTreeModel representing a Hoeffding Tree as described by

    Domingos/Hulten/2000: Mining HighSpeed Data Streams
    Author:
    Tobias Beckers
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  HoeffdingTree.NodeData
      Gathers all necessary data for a corresponding node including remaining features and counters in one object.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_DECLARE_NUMERIC
      The default number of different values existing for one feature to declare the feature FeatureType#NUMERIC: 5
      static double DEFAULT_DELTA
      The default value for delta.
      static QualityCriterion DEFAULT_QUALITY_CRITERION
      defines the default quality criterion: information gain
      static Double[] DEFAULT_QUANTILES
      The default quantiles for finding thresholds for numeric features: 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1
      protected Map<String,List<Serializable>> featureValuePairs
      contains all possible features and for each feature all possible values
      static QualityCriterion GINI_INDEX
      use this field to define the quality criterion to be Gini-Index gain
      static QualityCriterion INFORMATION_GAIN
      use this field to define the quality criterion to be information gain
      protected boolean initialized
      indicates if the learner is initialized so it has all necessary information for learning
      protected String labelAttribute
      Empty Constructor to instantiate the learner without initializing.
      protected List<Serializable> labels
      all possible labels
      protected double minQualityForSplit
      defines which value the quality function must deliver at least to split a node.
      protected Map<HoeffdingTreeNode,HoeffdingTree.NodeData> NodeDataPairs
      contains all current leafs and for each leaf the corresponding counters
      protected double numerator
      the numerator of the fraction under the square root in the hoeffding bound (used for epsilon computation)
      protected QualityCriterion qualityCriterion
      the chosen QualityCriterion
      protected HoeffdingTreeModel tree
      The resulting HoeffdingTree which is incrementally updated

      Initializes the learner with all necessary information.
      void learn(Data example)
      This method implements 'The Hoeffding tree algorithm' as presented in Table 1 on page 3 in
      Domingos/Hulten/2000: Mining HighSpeed Data Streams as precisely as possible.
      The comments in the method are taken from the original pseudo code implementation and each describes the following line(s).
      static Comparable numericToNominal(Collection<Comparable> nominalValues, Comparable numericValue)
      Maps the specified numeric value to one of the specified nominal values.
      Numeric and nominal values must be directly comparable.

    • Field Detail

      • INFORMATION_GAIN

        public static final QualityCriterion INFORMATION_GAIN
        use this field to define the quality criterion to be information gain

      • GINI_INDEX

        public static final QualityCriterion GINI_INDEX
        use this field to define the quality criterion to be Gini-Index gain

      • DEFAULT_DECLARE_NUMERIC

        public static final int DEFAULT_DECLARE_NUMERIC
        The default number of different values existing for one feature to declare the feature FeatureType#NUMERIC: 5
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_QUANTILES

        public static final Double[] DEFAULT_QUANTILES
        The default quantiles for finding thresholds for numeric features: 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1

      • DEFAULT_DELTA

        public static final double DEFAULT_DELTA
        The default value for delta. Delta is '1 - the probability to choose the correct feature at each node': 0.0000001
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_QUALITY_CRITERION

        public static final QualityCriterion DEFAULT_QUALITY_CRITERION
        defines the default quality criterion: information gain

      • tree

        protected HoeffdingTreeModel tree
        The resulting HoeffdingTree which is incrementally updated

      • featureValuePairs

        protected Map<String,List<Serializable>> featureValuePairs
        contains all possible features and for each feature all possible values

      • labels

        protected List<Serializable> labels
        all possible labels

      • NodeDataPairs

        protected Map<HoeffdingTreeNode,HoeffdingTree.NodeData> NodeDataPairs
        contains all current leafs and for each leaf the corresponding counters

      • numerator

        protected double numerator
        the numerator of the fraction under the square root in the hoeffding bound (used for epsilon computation)

      • qualityCriterion

        protected QualityCriterion qualityCriterion
        the chosen QualityCriterion

      • minQualityForSplit

        protected double minQualityForSplit
        defines which value the quality function must deliver at least to split a node. Default: Worst value

      • initialized

        protected boolean initialized
        indicates if the learner is initialized so it has all necessary information for learning

      • labelAttribute

        protected String labelAttribute
        Empty Constructor to instantiate the learner without initializing. The call of #learn(LabeledExample) will have no effect until the learner is initialized.
        It is recommended to instantiate the leaner with the constructors HoeffdingTree(Collection) or HoeffdingTree(Map, Map, List, double, QualityCriterion, double).

    • Constructor Detail

      • HoeffdingTree

        public HoeffdingTree()

      • HoeffdingTree

        public HoeffdingTree(String label)

      • HoeffdingTree

        public HoeffdingTree(Map<String,Class<?>> featureTypes,
             Map<String,List<Serializable>> featureValuePairs,
             List<Serializable> labels,
             double delta,
             QualityCriterion qualityCriterion,
             double minQualityForSplit)
        Most extensive constructor to define all parameters by setting them manually
        Parameters:
        featureTypes - for each feature one of HoeffdingTree#NOMINAL or HoeffdingTree#NUMERIC. Use HoeffdingTree#estimateFeatureTypes(Collection, int) to create this automatically.
        featureValuePairs - must contain all possible features and for each feature all possible values or thresholds if numeric. Use HoeffdingTree#constructFeatureValuePairs(Collection, Map, double...) to create this automatically.
        labels - must contain all possible labels. Use HoeffdingTree#getAllLabels(Collection) to extract all labels automatically.
        delta - the error bound parameter, is one minus the desired probability of choosing the correct attribute at any given node. Default value: DEFAULT_DELTA
        qualityCriterion - a QualityCriterion, e.g. INFORMATION_GAIN. Default: DEFAULT_QUALITY_CRITERION
        minQualityForSplit - used for pre-pruning: A node is not split until the hoeffding bound guarantees that the best feature has a quality of at least the specified. Default should be the QualityCriterion.getLowestGain() for the chosen criterion. For default criterion: HoeffdingTree#DEFAULT_QUALITY_CRITERION#getLowestGain()

      • HoeffdingTree

        public HoeffdingTree(Collection<Data> examples)
        Constructor sets all parameters to default
        Parameters:
        examples - a collection of LabeledExamples containing all possible features, all possible values for each nominal feature (and as much as possible for numeric features) and all possible labels.

      • getAllValues

        public List<Serializable> getAllValues(Collection<Data> examples,
                              String feature)
        Method for convenient initialization.
        Returns a list of all values - including duplicates - the specified feature can have in the specified collection of examples.
        Parameters:
        examples - all examples
        feature - a feature which values are wanted
        Returns:
        a list of all values - including duplicates - the specified feature can have in the specified collection of examples.

      • constructFeatureValuePairs

        public Map<String,List<Serializable>> constructFeatureValuePairs(Collection<Data> examples,
                                                        Map<String,Class<?>> featureTypes,
                                                        Double... quantileThresholds)
        Method for convenient initialization.
        Extracts all values from all nominal features and estimates threshold values for numeric features.
        Returns all (discretized) possible values for each feature.
        Parameters:
        examples - examples must contain all possible features and all possible values for nominal features
        featureTypes - for each feature one of HoeffdingTree#NOMINAL or HoeffdingTree#NUMERIC use HoeffdingTree#estimateFeatureTypes(Collection, int) to create this automatically
        quantileThresholds - quantiles to find the best thresholds. Default: DEFAULT_QUANTILES
        Returns:
        Returns all (discretized) possible values for each feature.

      • getAllFeatures

        public Set<String> getAllFeatures(Collection<Data> examples)
        Method for convenient initialization.
        Returns a set of all features seen at least once in the specified collection of examples.
        Parameters:
        examples - a collection of Examples to extract the features from
        Returns:
        a set of all features seen at least once in the specified collection of examples.

      • getNumericThresholds

        public static List<Serializable> getNumericThresholds(Collection<Serializable> values,
                                      Double... quantileThresholds)
        Method for convenient initialization.
        Returns a list of thresholds for testing values of the specified domain.
        All seen values - including duplicate values - should be specified.
        Quantiles must reside in interval [0,1]. The Number of specified quantiles define the number of returned thresholds (if enough different values exist). Default quantiles: DEFAULT_QUANTILES
        Parameters:
        values - all seen values, including duplicates
        quantileThresholds - quantiles to find the best thresholds. Default: DEFAULT_QUANTILES
        Returns:
        Returns a list of thresholds for numeric features

      • numericToNominal

        public static Comparable numericToNominal(Collection<Comparable> nominalValues,
                          Comparable numericValue)
        Maps the specified numeric value to one of the specified nominal values.
        Numeric and nominal values must be directly comparable.
        Parameters:
        nominalValues - possible mappings
        numericValue - a numeric value
        Returns:
        the nominal value to which the numeric value is mapped.

      • getModel

        public HoeffdingTreeModel getModel()
        Returns the so far learned tree. At any time through the learning process, this method returns a valid tree.
        Specified by:
        getModel in interface Learner<Data,HoeffdingTreeModel>
        Returns:
        the so far learned tree
        See Also:
        Model

      • learn

        public void learn(Data example)
        This method implements 'The Hoeffding tree algorithm' as presented in Table 1 on page 3 in
        Domingos/Hulten/2000: Mining HighSpeed Data Streams as precisely as possible.
        The comments in the method are taken from the original pseudo code implementation and each describes the following line(s).
        Specified by:
        learn in interface Learner<Data,HoeffdingTreeModel>
        Parameters:
        example - The input for the learning process
